document_title: Myocardial ischemia: Causes, signs, complications and prevention
subsection_content:
Myocardial ischemia is a disease that occurs when blood flow to the heart is reduced, causing the heart muscle to not receive enough oxygen. Reduced blood flow is often the result of partial or complete blockage of the heart's coronary arteries. Heart anemia occurs most often when the patient is physically active or excited (at this time the heart requires greater blood flow). (first)
Over time, the heart muscle is not supplied with enough blood and can become serious. When the heart does not receive enough oxygen and nutrients, it will damage the heart muscle and reduce heart function. In many cases, patients may face problems such as arrhythmia, heart failure, myocardial infarction, etc.
subsection_title: thieu mau co tim.json. What is myocardial ischemia?
